I just visited few days ago and it was kind of disappointing  .. one , the travel roads are under widening process which apparently has been going on for last few years.. ( it must be difficult hence delayed in the hills ) .. so be prepared for not just green stretches but also super dusty mountain stretches with cut up hills and construction vehicles marring your view ğŸ˜‚ğŸ¤£ I even noticed dynamite fuses to blow up the rocks obviously ğŸ˜† .. Shillong is a cramped small place with traffic snarls everywhere but the people are good .. restaurants and markets close down by 8.30 pm, they took my last order at 8.30 and promptly served noodles soup ( I had asked for veg noodles which means chow mein everywhere else but they served boiled noodles in soup and said you wanted noodles so this is it ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ so please ask for fried chow mein if you donâ€™t want the same fate ..any talk would be fruitless since it was closing time and I didnâ€™t want to go hungry..everything is closed by 8.30- 9pm max and no shops open before 10-11 especially in rural areas ..be it food , pharmacy or whatever.. even tourist destinations donâ€™t open before 8.30 mostly hence get up early to travel not to visit anything early morning..in short, people used to city life would find these challenges here ..also , there are mostly half to one n half km trek to reach many falls after you park your vehicle and then coming back so we get tired walking and canâ€™t really cover a lot in one day .. not for people with joint problems or small children so better to enquire in advance !! What would be 5 mins walk for a local would be 15 for an outsider so consider that too !! Arwah cave had no lights when we visited around 3.30 -4 pm so had to view using mobile phone torch inside ğŸ˜† natural views are beautiful but be prepared for tough walking bros .. also , there would be meat selling all around including beef and chicken which everyone wonâ€™t enjoy ( they could at least cover a bit for tourists maybe ğŸ˜† .. decent restaurants I found in Shillong .. till 8.30 pm  only.. I never entered a jadoh shop once I learned ja means rice and doh means any meat ..I really wished I would see picturesque scenes on the way but saw construction works and concrete homes mostly not the cute hilly cottages made with local materials that we see in pictures.. so not as good as I expected, though destinations are beautiful ğŸ˜ğŸŒ·

The most recent happen in 2020 towards Bengali Hindus again only due to Covid restrictions it didn't turn too ugly. Currently in 2022 the government want 300 odd Punjabi family to relocate who has been staying in Meghalaya even before independence of India.
